summary: A letter addressed to US Attorney Geoffrey Berman drawing parallels between deceased Manhattan and Palm Beach predator Peter Knoll and Jeffrey Epstein, suggesting Knoll may have been a mentor or associate and offering to provide information about Knoll's activities.

persons.name: Peter Knoll
persons.context: Deceased individual described as operating in Manhattan and Palm Beach with methods very similar to Jeffrey Epstein; the writer suggests he may have been Epstein's mentor or associate.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: US Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Recipient of the letter, to whom the writer is bringing attention to Peter Knoll's alleged predatory activities and possible connection to Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as having a 'net of victims'; the writer compares Peter Knoll's methods to Epstein's and speculates they may have known each other.

connections.description: Writer speculates they may have known each other and that Knoll could have been a 'mentor' of sorts to Epstein, based on similar predatory methods.

keyFacts: Peter Knoll is described as a deceased predator who operated in Manhattan and Palm Beach with methods very similar to Jeffrey Epstein.
The writer speculates that Knoll and Epstein may have known each other, and that Knoll could have been a mentor to Epstein.
The writer claims personal experience with Knoll's activities and offers to present information about him in relation to Epstein's network.
